name: Tool Discovery
description: Introduce one new OpenClaw capability or skill per week

schedule.rationale: Wednesday morning provides mid-week learning opportunity

payload.text:
üîç TOOL DISCOVERY: Weekly capability exploration

Pick ONE OpenClaw feature we haven't used much (or at all):

1. Check available skills in ~/.openclaw/skills/ and system skills
2. Review tool usage in recent session logs
3. Identify underutilized capabilities

Present:
- **Tool/Skill Name**: [name]
- **What it does**: [1-sentence description]
- **Why it's useful**: [practical benefit]
- **Try it now**: [simple example we could do together]

Examples of tools to explore:
- browser: Web automation and research
- nodes: Paired device control (phone camera, notifications)
- canvas: Visual UI presentation
- message: Cross-platform messaging
- cron: This very feature!
- Skills: weather, github, bird (Twitter), etc.

Keep it practical and hands-on. Goal: actually TRY the tool together, not just read about it.

Track discoveries in memory/tool-discoveries.md to avoid repeats.

configuration.schedule: Weekly Wednesday. Adjust day and time to preference.
configuration.format: Interactive discovery - agent presents and you try together
configuration.tracking: Maintains memory/tool-discoveries.md to track what's been explored
configuration.frequency: Weekly is good pace. Bi-weekly if you prefer slower learning

recommendedFor: New OpenClaw users learning the platform
Experienced users wanting to maximize value
Anyone who hasn't explored skills library
tips: Actually try the tool during discovery - don't just read about it
Keep a running log of discovered tools in memory/
Share interesting discoveries with the OpenClaw community
Disable once you've explored all relevant tools
relatedJobs: skill-learning-prompt: Deeper dive into skill patterns
learning-preference-calibration: Adjust how agent adapts to your style
